items.name: X-Men: The Complete Age of Apocalypse Epic Book 4 (Trade Paperback)
X-Men: The Complete Age of Apocalypse Epic Book 4 (2006)

wiki.relatives: Nikolai Rasputin (father, deceased), Alexandra Rasputina (mother, deceased), Piotr Rasputin ([[Colossus (Piotr Rasputin)|Colossus]], brother), [[Rasputin, Mikhail|Mikhail Rasputin]] (brother), Peter Jr (nephew)
wiki.education: High-school level courses at Xavier’s School
wiki.powers: Magik had the [[Glossary:M#mutant|mutant]] power to [[Glossary:T#teleportation|teleport]] through time and space by creating portals into the pocket [[Glossary:D#dimension|dimension]] [[Otherplace]]. The greater the distance over which she teleported, the greater the possible margin of error in both space and time.
wiki.weapons: Magik wielded the Soulsword, the ultimate expression of her mystical power, to disrupt magical spells and injure or kill supernatural beings, though it had no physical effect on a non-supernatural creature, passing right through such a creature as if it were intangible.
wiki.debut: (As Illyana) Giant-Size X-Men #1 (1975), (as Magik) New Mutants #14 (1984)
wiki.significant_issues: Captured by Arcade, rescued by X-Men, stayed in America (Uncanny X-Men #145-148, 1981); kidnapped by Belasco to Limbo, trained as sorceress, defeated Belasco, returned as adolescent (Uncanny X-Men #160/Magik: Storm & Illyana #1-4, 1982); joined New Mutants as Magik (New Mutants #14-17, 1984); transformed into Darkchilde, sacrificed magic nature to prevent demonic invasion, deaged (New Mutants #72-73, 1989); revealed to have Legacy Virus, died (Uncanny X-Men #300-303, 1993)
wiki.bio_text: The younger sister of the [[X-Men|X-Man]] [[Colossus (Piotr Rasputin)|Colossus]], Illyana came to live with her brother after being kidnapped by the eccentric assassin [[Arcade]]. Months later, the sorcerer [[Belasco]] captured Illyana and held her prisoner in the pocket dimension Otherplace, a.k.a. [[Glossary:L#limbo|Limbo]]. Belasco turned a portion of her [[Glossary:S#soul|soul]] [[Glossary:D#demon|demonic]] in nature, and in the process conjured a “bloodstone” gem from her soul. When Belasco conjured five such gems, Illyana, who would have transformed into the entirely demonic Darkchilde, would serve as the means by which Belasco’s demon masters, [[Chthon]] and the [[N'Garai]], could conquer [[Earth]].
wiki.bio:
The younger sister of the [[X-Men|X-Man]] [[Colossus (Piotr Rasputin)|Colossus]], Illyana came to live with her brother after being kidnapped by the eccentric assassin [[Arcade]]. Months later, the sorcerer [[Belasco]] captured Illyana and held her prisoner in the pocket dimension Otherplace, a.k.a. [[Glossary:L#limbo|Limbo]]. Belasco turned a portion of her [[Glossary:S#soul|soul]] [[Glossary:D#demon|demonic]] in nature, and in the process conjured a “bloodstone” gem from her soul. When Belasco conjured five such gems, Illyana, who would have transformed into the entirely demonic Darkchilde, would serve as the means by which Belasco’s demon masters, [[Chthon]] and the [[N'Garai]], could conquer [[Earth]].


Belasco’s spell gave Illyana considerable magical power, and she nearly killed him, but decided not to give in to her demonic side and drove him from Otherplace, becoming its new leader. Illyana returned to Earth at a point only seconds after the X-Men’s escape from Otherplace. However, whereas only seconds had passed for the X-Men, Illyana had aged seven years in Otherplace and was now 13 years old. She then joined the team of [[Glossary:S#superhuman|superhuman]] mutant trainees the New Mutants as Magik.

Belasco’s former servant [[S’ym]] later seized control of Otherplace and spearheaded an invasion of Earth. In an effort to defeat him, Illyana retroactively erased her existence as Magik by using her mutant powers to alter time, and as a result the invasion effectively never took place. Illyana emerged from the enchantment as her younger self, possessing no magical abilities and having a pure soul. Ultimately, Illyana contracted the deadly mutant-killing [[Glossary:L#Legacy Virus|Legacy Virus]] and died. It was later revealed that her eldest brother Mikhail had actually given her the Virus after the past New Mutants travelled into the future to meet their present-day counterparts.

Her spirit however contacted both Wolverine and Piotr from the afterlife. She came to Logan shortly after he had the adamantium pulled from his body, and urged him to return to the world of the living to save Jean Grey. Illyana's spirit returned again,[16] this time to her brother Piotr, who had recently returned to the X-Men and the United States with Kitty and Nightcrawler following the disbanding of Excalibur. When investigating odd occurrences inside the Mansion, Piotr located one of stepping disks that Illyana had magically bound to the school. He found himself transported to a pocket world, which held a memory imprint of Illyana. There Piotr manages to learn how to let go a little more and to move on with his life, while still remembering his sister.

Despite this, Illyana's memory convinced him to make one final sacrifice. When the cure for the Legacy Virus turned out to need the death of one mutant, he secretly and willingly gave his life, so nobody else would have to die like Illyana did. Colossus would later be resurrected by an alien race. In addition, when Colossus visited Breakworld it was mentioned by Danger (the Danger Room AI) that the "magic bullet" headed towards Earth held Illyana's genetic signature.
categories: People who used to be dead but aren't anymore
